original_title: Sri Lanka tea production up 21-pct in October
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s tea production grew up 22 percent to 22.85 million kilograms in October 2023 from 18.75 million kilograms a year earlier, with a recovery in low grown teas, industry data showed.
Low Grown production in October 2023 went up to 14.8 million kilograms from 11.7 million last year.
High Grown production went up to 4.1 million kilograms from 3.95 kilograms last year. Mid Growns were up to 3.9 million from 3.0 million.
Up to October production was only up 2.3 percent from a year earlier to 216.2 million kilograms.
Tea production was going up with fertilizer application coming back and also rainfall, officials said.
In October there were excessive rainfall, but weather conditions in November was better which would help production in December, industry official said. (Colombo/Nov23/2023)
